title: 820-3332 Battery Detection
message:
Hello,

I am not getting battery detection on this logic board. Tested with a known good battery.

Checked resistance on R5280 and R5281. No corrosion around the SMC that I can tell. PP3V42_G3H is present.

SMBUS_BATT_SCL (SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL) was shorted to ground, the SDA line was OK. 

I replaced the ISL6258 U7000 and the short is gone, and diode mode measurements put it in line with another board that I had.

Any thoughts? Bad SMC?

Thanks,

Stefan

title: 820-3332 Battery Detection
message: Yup SMC is dead. U7000 is an ISL6259, not 58!

title: 820-3332 Battery Detection
message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="30%"]19207._xfImport[/ATTACH]
Yup. Schematic threw me off!

Double checked with a new ISL625[B]9[/B] chip, battery detection still f***ed.

Is it worth buying the kit to reball an SMC and replace this one, when I have maybe had 2 so far that would need this?

Thanks

title: 820-3332 Battery Detection
message: SMC repair is a common problem, definitely need to be able to do that.
